main event: Two bright silvery, disc-shaped objects were observed flying in formation over Dallas, Texas in 1949. The objects were approximately the size of a nickel and appeared to be linked together but with no visible linkage.
interesting points: The objects were bright silvery in color and were described as resembling perfect flat round discs.
They maintained a formation with one object following the other.
The observer estimated the altitude of the objects to be approximately 45 degrees above the horizon.
The objects were observed for approximately 5 minutes, and there was no sound or odor associated with them.
Weather conditions at the time of the sighting included heavy clouds to the south and lightning, with clear-open skies in the north.
